ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned how to write a report, evaluate papers, code r, and understand how to go about statistical research in the MENA region!
Political science, elections, Middle East, parties, voting, data analysis, logical thinking, structured thinking,

SO MUCH! In addition to strengthening my R skills immensely, Professor Tavana guided us skillfully through the art of how to read scholarly articles, especially those which were data-driven. Subjects were chosen with immense care. There was never a dull moment. Absolutely take this course if you get the chance.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strength: Professor Tavana is AMAZING!! 

Weakness: I wish it was in person!

This was easily one of the best classes I have ever taken. Professor Tavana has created an excellent course that should be emulated by staff not only across Yale but across all top tier colleges. The class was incredibly coherent, there was strong thought behind the readings and they all linked up superbly. The homework added a lot to the overall class and learnings. I would like to express a deep thank you to Professor Tavana.

Strengths: Fantastic professor who really cares about his students and their welfare; well-chosen subject matter; practical and great thesis of the course; careful use of R. 

Weaknesses: Professor Tavana won't be at Yale next year to teach this class again.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I really enjoyed everything about this course! I just wish it was in person bc it could have been awesome to spend time with the class that way!
The class was superb. Prof Tavana did extremely well in getting everyone engaged and learning despite the difficulties of Covid.
Success: Cares about his students and their welfare and checks in on us from time to time.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: If you are interested in at least exploring r and/or the MENA region and research happening there, take this class!
Yes, 100%. Everyone doing anything remotely related to political science or business should take this class. This class is one of the best classes on the topic ever made.

YES YES YES. Tavana is a fantastic professor, we dove into necessary subjects and learned how to read and how to analyze articles. This class soared over just about every other course I have taken, and I have taken a lot of great courses.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Virtual seminar with five students to talk about the readings and discuss learnings.
